instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> display issue
threads.message:
I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> that has a display issue as pictured , I changed the cable but the issue persists. 

Is this display toasted or is there a chance there could be an issue with the board? 


[ATTACH]59447[/ATTACH]
